attributes.action: Provide N.H.S. and Essential Services with long term support.
attributes.additional_details: Giving a small pay rise or a £500 bonus to just the NHS is not enough, we need to see real, long term help and benefits to all of those who worked in essential services during the pandemic and to show that working in dangerous situations has meaningful compensation.
attributes.background:
Benefits to all who worked during the pandemic for at least 60 days in essential services:
-Low-cost mortgages,
-Low-interest loans to start a business or farm, or to pay for any outstanding debts
-Support for tuition & living expenses to attend F.E., vocational school or university.

rejection.details:
The provision, and associated repayment terms, of mortgages and other kinds of loans are a matter for individual lenders, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a petition calling on the Government to fund tuition fees and living expenses for all public sector workers for a set period of time, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

You may like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568085
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560696
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569251
